Spell mastery — If there are two or more instant and/or sorcery cards in your graveyard, search your library for up to three basic Forest cards instead of two.

name: Oblivion Ring
oracle_text:
When Oblivion Ring enters the battlefield, exile another target nonland permanent.
When Oblivion Ring leaves the battlefield, return the exiled card to the battlefield under its owner's control.

name: Okina Nightwatch
oracle_text: As long as you have more cards in hand than each opponent, Okina Nightwatch gets +3/+3.
flavor_text: Only the most skilled budoka could protect the Okina Shrine. Only the best of these protectors took the night watch.

name: Opal Palace
oracle_text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{1}, {T}: Add one mana of any color in your commander's color identity. If you spend this mana to cast your commander, it enters the battlefield with a number of additional +1/+1 counters on it equal to the number of times it's been cast from the command zone this game.

name: Ophidian
oracle_text: Whenever Ophidian attacks and isn't blocked, you may draw a card. If you do, Ophidian assigns no combat damage this turn.

"I will . . . tell thee more than thou hast wit to ask."
—Christopher Marlowe, *Doctor Faustus*

name: Opt
oracle_text:

Draw a card.

name: Orzhov Signet
flavor_text: The form of the sigil is just as important as the sigil itself. If it's carried on a medallion, its bearer is a master. If it's tattooed on the body, its bearer is a slave.

name: Path of Ancestry
oracle_text:
Path of Ancestry enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add one mana of any color in your commander's color identity. When that mana is spent to cast a creature spell that shares a creature type with your commander, scry 1. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.)

Flying
